column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Four Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 992 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday
column5: 585 on Tuesday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.The number of positive cases confirmed in the past seven days was 11
column9: 840 in the previous seven days. There are 332 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in Northern Ireland
column10: down from 341 on Tuesday.Thirty patients with Covid-19 are being treated in intensive care units
column11: up from 29 on Tuesday.Last updated 01 December at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 3
column13: 854 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in Northern Ireland as of Wednesday.Of those
column16: 570 of the jabs were first doses
column20: 649 were third doses.The remainder were booster jabs.Last updated 01 December at 14:00 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 3
column21: 793 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Wednesday
column23: 471 on Tuesday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
column26: is updated weekly and includes "probable and possible" Covid-19-linked deaths.There are 578 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in the Republic of Ireland.One-hundred-and-seventeen patients with Covid-19 are being treated in intensive care units.Last updated 1 December at 18:00 local timeSource: Department of Health IrelandA total of 7
column28: 465 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in the Republic of Ireland as of Tuesday.A total of 3
column30: 114 people have had their first dose and 3
column32: 893 have had their second dose.A total of 839
column33: 971 booster jabs have been administered.Last updated 01 December at 18:00 local timeSource: Department of Health Ireland
